Article/0-0-0-18/routes-and-params.title: Routes and Params
Article/0-0-0-18/routes-and-params.html:
Nullstack has built-in routes, it would make no sense otherwise since web applications are expected to have hyperlinks.<\/p>

Any tag can receive a route<\/code> attribute, be it a component, inner component, or simple HTML tag.<\/p> 

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Page from<\/span> './Page'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  renderHome<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>section<\/span>><\/span><\/span> Home </<\/span>section<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>
 
  render<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>count}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>Home<\/span><\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/"<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>Page<\/span><\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/page"<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>abbr<\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/abbreviations"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> Abbreviations </<\/span>abbr<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
      </<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Links<\/a><\/h2>
Links on Nullstack are simple a<\/code> tags with the href<\/code> value starting with /<\/code>.<\/p>

<<\/span>a<\/span> href<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/page/about"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> About Page </<\/span>a<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<<\/span>a<\/span> path<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/page/about"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> About Page </<\/span>a<\/span>><\/span><\/span> {<\/span>/* changes page keeping query params */<\/span>}<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>



üí° On the client side the click event will push history without reloading the page.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>



‚ú® You can still assign your own click event to the tag without losing the framework behavior.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>



‚ú® If a link doesn't start with /<\/code> it's considered an external link and will not use the router.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Params<\/a><\/h2>
The params<\/code> key is an object proxy injected into every client instance.<\/p>

Each query string param is mapped to this object.<\/p>

By default any key you request from this object will return a string.<\/p>

If the value is undefined<\/code> it will return an empty string.<\/p>

If the value is true<\/code> or false<\/code> it will return a boolean instead.<\/p>



üê±‚Äçüíª Bellow an exemple that visits "/books?expanded=true&page=2":<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Books<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  async<\/span> initiate<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>params}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    if<\/span>(<\/span>params.<\/span>expanded)<\/span> {<\/span>
      const<\/span> page =<\/span> parseInt<\/span>(<\/span>params.<\/span>page)<\/span> ||<\/span> 1<\/span>;<\/span>
      this<\/span>.<\/span>books =<\/span> await<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>getBooks<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>page}<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
    }<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Books;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Assigning to a params key will cause a redirect to the route with updated params.<\/p>

When you assign to a param, the value will be converted to JSON before being set.<\/p>



üí° Redirects work in batches, so there is no performance loss in multiple assignments.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Paginator<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  handleClick<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>params}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    params.<\/span>filter =<\/span> ''<\/span>;<\/span>
    params.<\/span>page =<\/span> 1<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Paginator;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Assigning an empty string to a param will remove it from the url.<\/p>

Dynamic Segments<\/a><\/h2>
Part of the route can be an expression started with ":" followed by a param name.<\/p>

This value will be matched against any string in the same directory position.<\/p>

The value of the string in the URL will be assigned to the context<\/a> params and functions below this point in the hierarchy will have access to the new key.<\/p>



üê±‚Äçüíª Bellow an example that visits "/category/suspense?page=2":<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Books<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  async<\/span> initiate<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>params}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    const<\/span> page =<\/span> parseInt<\/span>(<\/span>params.<\/span>page)<\/span> ||<\/span> 1<\/span>;<\/span>
    const<\/span> category =<\/span> params.<\/span>slug;<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>books =<\/span> await<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>getBooks<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>category,<\/span> page}<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Books;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Books from<\/span> './Books'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    <<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
      <<\/span>Books<\/span><\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/category/:slug"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    </<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

When a dynamic segment is changed, as for example moving from "/category/suspense" to "/category/comedy", the component will be terminated and a new instance will be created.<\/p>

Changing a query param will not re-instantiate the component.<\/p>

Children of the component will not be re-instantiated automatically, you can set the same route to the children or do it manually if you desire this behavior.<\/p>



üí° The behavior mentioned above solves many of the problems you have to normally deal with manually.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Wildcards<\/a><\/h2>
Wildcards are routes declared with "*" as the attribute value.<\/p>

These routes will match anything if nothing above it matches the requested URL.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Home from<\/span> './Home'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>count}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>Home<\/span><\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/"<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>div<\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>*"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> Wildcard </<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
      </<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Wildcards can be prefixed with a segment.<\/p>



‚ú® this is especially useful for engines that can be mounted in your application.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Home from<\/span> './Home'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> BlogEngine from<\/span> './BlogEngine'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>count}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>Home<\/span><\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/"<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>BlogEngine<\/span><\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/blog/*"<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
      </<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Router<\/a><\/h2>
The router<\/code> key is an object proxy injected into every client instance.<\/p>

The router<\/code> has three keys:<\/p>

    

  • url<\/code><\/strong><\/li>

  • path<\/code><\/strong><\/li>

  • base<\/code><\/strong><\/li>

  • previous<\/code><\/strong><\/li>
<\/ul>

    The url<\/code> key returns everything after the domain including the path and the query params as a string.<\/p>

    The path<\/code> key returns only the path without query params.<\/p>

    The base<\/code> key returns only the base url (e.g: https://nullstack.app<\/code> or http://localhost:5000<\/code>).<\/p>

    The previous<\/code> key is the same as url<\/code>, but for the previous route. Defaults do null<\/code> (e.g. when first accessing app).<\/p>

    

    üí° Those keys above automatically remove the trailing slash for convenience.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

    Assigning to url<\/code> or path<\/code> will cause a redirect.<\/p>

    Assigning a absolute url to url<\/code> will cause a full reload.<\/p>

    import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  prepare<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>router}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    if<\/span>(<\/span>router.<\/span>path ==<\/span> '/'<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
      router.<\/span>path =<\/span> '/dashboard'<\/span>;<\/span> // simple route change<\/span>
    }<\/span> else<\/span> {<\/span>
      router.<\/span>url =<\/span> 'https://my-domain.app'<\/span> // full reload<\/span>
    }<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    

    üí° Under the hood a<\/code> tags with params<\/code> use the router<\/code>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

    Custom Events<\/a><\/h2>
    Updating router.url<\/code> or router.path<\/code> will raise a custom event.<\/p>

    import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Analytics<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  hydrate<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>router}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    window.<\/span>addEventListener<\/span>(<\/span>router.<\/span>event,<\/span> (<\/span>)<\/span> =><\/span> {<\/span>
      console.<\/span>log<\/span>(<\/span>router.<\/span>url)<\/span>;<\/span>
    }<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Analytics;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    Special anchors<\/a><\/h2>
    Anchor tags accept some convenient special attributes besides the regular href<\/code>.<\/p>

    You can set the params<\/code> attribute with an object as the value.<\/p>

    The path will remain the same as the current router path, but the params<\/code> will be replaced by the new params you specify.<\/p>

    <<\/span>a<\/span> params<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>{<\/span>page<\/span>:<\/span> 1<\/span>}<\/span>}<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> First Page </<\/span>a<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    If you wish to just update some params and keep the others, you can use the JavaScript spread operator for that.<\/p>

    <<\/span>a<\/span> params<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>{<\/span>...<\/span>params,<\/span> page<\/span>:<\/span> 1<\/span>}<\/span>}<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> First Page </<\/span>a<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    You can set the path<\/code> attribute with a string starting with "/" and no query params.<\/p>

    The params will remain the same, but the path<\/code> will be updated.<\/p>

    <<\/span>a<\/span> path<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/category/suspense"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> Suspense Books </<\/span>a<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    Both attributes above can be used at the same time.<\/p>

    <<\/span>a<\/span> path<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/category/suspense"<\/span><\/span> params<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>{<\/span>...<\/span>params,<\/span> page<\/span>:<\/span> 1<\/span>}<\/span>}<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> Suspense Books </<\/span>a<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    Nested routes<\/a><\/h2>
    The first route to be matched will be rendered.<\/p>

    The other elements with a route will not be rendered, however, elements on the same level without a route<\/code> attribute will render normally.<\/p>

    The router will lookup for one route per dom depth level, this allows you to have nested routing behavior.<\/p>

    import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Home from<\/span> './Home'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  renderPage<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>section<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>div<\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/page/about"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> About Page </<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>div<\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/page/contact"<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> Contact Page </<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
      </<\/span>section<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>
 
  render<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span>count}<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>Home<\/span><\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/"<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>Page<\/span><\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/page/:slug"<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
      </<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    Instances<\/a><\/h2>
    By default components with a route will have the current url as the key.<\/p>

    This behaviour causes the component to be reinstantiated and run lifecycle again even when params change, which is very helpful to load content based on urls.<\/p>

    To skip the behaviour above you can define a custom key to the component.<\/p>

    import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Home from<\/span> './Home'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Page from<\/span> './Page'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>
 
  render<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> router }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>Home<\/span><\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/"<\/span><\/span> key<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>home"<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>Page<\/span><\/span> route<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>/page/:slug"<\/span><\/span> key<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>router.<\/span>path}<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
      </<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

page.description: Nullstack has built-in routes, it would make no sense otherwise since web applications are expected to have hyperlinks.
